content: If you want your kids to deal with adult issues, and add a little stress to their day, let them watch this film before the age of 12.Wonderful movie aside of the age limit. A must see!

title: Best movie ever!
content: I think this is the best movie ever! I love everything about it. Characters are very good made, and while watching you become full of emotions. I recommend that movie not only to children but to all people. Nick is such a good character. He is such a good friend to Judy. At the start, he does not like her. But in the end, they become best friends. And also I should point out, this is the only animated film I EVER cried about. I can not wait for Zootopia 2 and 3!

title: Finally a movie with a strong female character!
content: ...even if she is, you know, a bunny.Judy starts her police training being smaller and weaker than the other recruits, but she overcomes all these difficulties not by some magical talent (live-action Mulan, I'm looking at you) but by sheer perseverance and cleverness.She is bullied, mobbed and put down by her male colleagues, who are not intrinsecally bad or evil but simply old fashioned, and in the end Judy manages to show them the error of their ways.I liked that the screenwriters didn't make Judy seem smarter by making every male around her look weak or dumb (True Detective Night Country, looking at you now): she actually comes up with some excellent ideas as to how to pursue the investigation.Sure, she is scared and has her moments of weakness (who doesn't!) but this simply means that she is not a cardboard character. She's also a bit racist (understandably) but in the end she overcomes this bad trait and becomes a better person.I wish more Hollywood storytellers would learn from this excellent movie when they try to tell stories about strong women! And, yes, the kids love this because it's full of fuzzy characters and funny jokes - but it's also a deep movie about racism, patriarchy and how to make them things of the past.

title: My Inner Child & Mature Self, Were Equally Satisfied
content: Zootopia is another resounding original from Disney, as it joins the likes of Your Name & Kubo atop the pinnacle of the 2016's best animated offerings. This, along with its numerous accolades that includes an Oscar win, comes to no surprise, as Zootopia boasts of a cross-generational appeal, leaving "children of all ages" hooked & entertained.Zootopia's visual flavor & meticulously crafted world driven by both reality & imagination gets first dibs on praise. Its render of its animal characters was astoundingly detailed, with designs specific to each. The creativity furthers with Zootopia's own construct, where animal habitats form its regions, each with its own quirk the characters & screenplay take advantage of. Happily, Disney ensures this fictional world is recognizable still, with its true to life depiction of features & peculiarities.Apart from its touch of eye candy, Zootopia's writing deserves a thousand mentions, as it is quite possibly its most stellar asset. Judy Hopps & Nick Wilde for instance, are well envisioned, lovable characters that are given rich backstories & grounded personalities & even flaws, that makes them a breeze to root for. On the other hand, its mature messages that touches on stereotypes, prejudice & how politics weave through these, was a pleasant, welcome surprise. Amazingly, Zootopia veers away from being preachy despite its themes, as its brand of comedy & light hearted fun remain its main draw. And man, was it funny.In case not clear, Disney hits a massive home run in Zootopia. Here, the studio showcases a deeply entertaining marriage of animal acting as humans and modern day humor & animation, with important themes managed very well along its childish motif. Wonderfully voiced too!PS What a year 2016 is for animated films!

title: Oh trust me, i mean it!!
content: This is one of the most cringe movies to come out of Disney's studios. This looks more like something you would get from Dreamworks. I wouldn't let my kids watch this even if I had any. I'll begin having one of the worst headaches to if the magic school bus just accidentally imbeggined inside my small intestine. I didn't want to go to bed but I didn't want to talk to anyone for about a week. This will be the last time I ever watch this movie ever. If I come over to your house and it's on the tv. I'm firing up my exhaust pipes driving to go to waffle house, and I will be waiting there until the movie is over.

title: Zootopia !

title: worth watching
content: From the town of rabbit nest to the animal City, from the traffic assistant to the police officer, these changes are not accidental. If there is no dream, no self-confidence, no wisdom, no partner, no tortuous experience, how can there be a perfect ending! This movie is suitable for everyone to watch. In the eyes of children, this movie can bring them different visual effects, such as cute animals, prosperous big cities, green forests, white glaciers, and inspirational little white rabbits. In the eyes of adults, the film reflects more moral. Having dreams, customer service difficulties, building friendship, eliminating racial discrimination and respecting others are the basic principles of life, and also the road to success. It's a very inspirational movie, worth watching!

title: An amazing story
content: Zootopia has such an amazing story and it really is a good movie. The story really has its political aspects to it and for a Disney film I wasn't expecting it at all. The star studded cast is brilliant and it seems like every character is voiced by a Hollywood actor. For a film that went slightly under the radar I've got to say this is one of the best modern Disney animations I've seen. It is hilarious aswell, it has so many meta jokes and a lot of pop culture references which I didn't expect at all, it's just a really fun and enjoyable film. Really enjoyed it!

title: The kids loved it, I loved it more!

title: I hate this movie! Sorry
content: Most people do like this movie, that's good for them. I obviously didn't! I honestly don't get it why people say this is for both kids and adults.This is most obviously a kids movie! The story is tedious and predictable, the humor is nearly non-existent, the characers are either dull or even unlikable, and also I can't stand Shakira's song when it plays. I even had to mute the movie while watching it.The only good things I can give credit for is that the animation is well done with some creativity displayed, some of the jokes were funny, and it does handle its message about accepting each other decently.Even so, I don't recommend watching this movie!!!

title: Super funny, smart and suspenseful
content: Excellent animation movie. Great jokes and very good suspenseful story. A lot of smart dialogue and relatable. Kind message, nice for both kids and adults to take in.Animation is also very well done, Ice age style. The rithm of the story is fast and you don't feel the time passing by. The voices are also very well done, with accents and built in humour. The story has a few very funny and surprising twists, which keeps you hanging until the end of the movie. The movie addresses a few very actual topics about discrimination and preconceptions and handles them in a balanced and positive way.All in all good entertainment with a good message.

title: Gentle slap on the face of prejudice
content: Sometimes the society sets norms and standards, you start following and without even knowing you are becoming prejudiced,biased to the other part of the society. This happens in layers . This is the harsh reality. But how to gently package it and present it? Through the animated movie.Story about judy hopps ,a country rabbit joining the police force . It shows how she suffers from prejudice and furthermore how she becomes one who becomes biased to other stereotypes as well.Nicely written,edited and a perfect watch.

title: great movie for children and adults
content: Zootopia is a Disney animated movie featuring the voices of Jason Bateman, and Ginnifer Goodwin. The film revolves around a police officer bunny rabbit who teams up with a con artist fox to takedown a conspiracy. I've always admired Disney and their unlimited imaginations that go beyond time and space. But I have to say that Zootopia is my favorite Disney film that they have created. What's genius about this movie is that they take an exact replica of our society and transform it into an anthropomorphic city called Zootopia where everybody lives in perfect harmony. And like our society where we deal with issues like racism, sexism, and other topics, they take those issues and pack it into Zootopia, while at the same time keeping it entertaining for adults and children. I also want to give the screenwriters credit for working as a team while the first half of them creating a controversial topics, while keeping it clean, while the other half on taking classic works like Agatha Christie or Sherlock Holmes and putting it into Zootopia. I was so impressed with this film that I wanted to watch it again because i wanted to soak up Zootopia and see how every animal fits their job that they work at. So in the end, I will say that Zootopia is my favorite Disney film that everyone needs to check out.

title: Physically painful
content: First 40 minutes were fun, light and entertaining, i would describe that kind of experience as "excellent", but after next 16 minutes film it was set to zero. After finishing i've felt very much like (mentally) squeezed lemon. Everything that happened after 40 minutes is complete narration's inconsequential disaster for 6 year old kids( and HOW it happened and directed)! I mean, it amazes me every time how in nearly every series or movie it starts with something cool and then end on the bottom, when suddenly everything stops being sane, when writing, dialogues, plot becomes over the top idiotic and unsatisfying in any way! Definitely skip this one. Movie for the kids(or how they often called "for family view") not means "bad movie". So, what you want is good animated movie? Go check Finding Nemo, Incredibles,Schreck 2, Cars or if you not care so much about top tier animation something like Dobrynya and the Dragon.

title: Not what I expected and why hasn't there been Zootropolis 2?
content: I really do enjoy this movie on repeat viewings. I did not expect it. There is enough here for kids and adults, if anything more for adults than I expected. The animation is really good and the ideas behind the various areas of zootropolis city are really thoughtful. The little rodent neighbourhood was brilliant. The voice tala t was excellent. I did not realise it won an Oscar and a BAFTA for best animation amongst others. Come on Disney give us another one!!!!

title: Favorite Disney Movie Ever
content: The ideals represented in Zootopia are more relevant to the real world than any other Disney movie I've seen. There are the more obvious principles of social justice on full display here, such as the themes of diversity and tolerance for others-obviously embodied by the primary duo of the film being "natural" enemies: a fox and a rabbit. What sets Zootopia apart though is how well it treats the issues and how the themes apply not only to issues of racial bias, but to all forms of intolerance of any number of personal traits. The themes of inclusion extend to all groups or persons who might feel othered for any reason.Zootopia also features strong themes of believing in yourself and in others. Of breaking out of the mould of what the world tells you are your limits or how high you should aim. Or even the value of having any notion of reaching after your aspirations at all, instead of settling for the familiar well-worn path of your parents and those around you. The idea of daring to tread the unpaved road.From a cinematic perspective, the characters are great and the world is both beautiful and intriguing. Ample amount of humor too.

title: It's fine - tries way too hard
content: On paper, this movie is exactly what I would enjoy. But the execution is very...shallow.You can see the amount of thought and effort put into the overall world when looking at the concept art and notes. I like how they thought out how a world of animals walking on two legs would work.Yet this movie falls flat for me. First off, it's a simple buddy cop movie. I don't really like either protagonist, and none of the other characters. Judy is shallowly peppy and just a tad annoying. I see how I could like her, but I don't. Nick is trying to be a sly fox character type, but it feels like they're trying to hard to make him lovable.In fact, the entire movie feels like it's trying to hard to be as marketable as possible. Every sequence is based off a joke, and it it doesn't land, you have to sit through an entirely long unfunny sequence.Every scene, moment and object is desperately trying to be something they can market with. Something that the masses are guaranteed to find enticing. Which results in a shallow movie that tries way too hard to get it's audience's shallow adoration.The racism metaphor is shallow and doesn't really make sense. What'd make more sense is animals judging each other because of fur color or size, etc. I think predator vs. Prey can be done right as an allegory (BeastStars) but Zootopia is not subtle enough for that.I honestly think they should've done their original idea. Following a fox growing up in a society where predators have to wear shock collars, to placate the prey, is fascinating. It creates this greater divide and a stronger force to fight against. It'd allow for more quiet thoughtful moments, and showcasing first hand what it feels like to live in a world that hates you. The finale would've been this big show in the arena. That just sounds much more provocative.But like Disney always does, they have a perfect idea right before they stomp it out and make it generic for the masses.

title: fun for the whole fam-ba-lee
content: Judy is a rabbit, who dreams up growing up to be a police officer. Her parents try to talk her out of it. But judy persists. When she gets on the police force, she's relegated to writing parking tickets. But she doesn't settle for that! Purely by accident, she lands in the middle of the city's biggest unsolved case. And in spite of the odds, the danger, and the fact that she comes from a family of prey, she's determined to solve the case. She meets up with a predator. Nick, a sly fox. He's got a dark side, but they warm up to each other, and together they try to find the missing citizens. Cute. Goal-positive messages. Some fun jokes about rabbits that know how to multiply! And an elephant who can't remember anything. Sloths running the dmv. A couple godfather movie jokes. Much talk about not judging a book by its cover.. ie... predators versus the prey. Stars the voices of ginnifer goodwin and jason bateman. Directed by the team of byron howard, rich moore, jared bush. Really good!

title: "Zootopia" Review
content: Disney's new animated feature, "Zootopia," centers on a metropolis that is home to many anthropomorphic animals, big or small. New police department recruit Judy Hopps is the first rabbit officer to join the force, but she soon faces the challenges that occur, such as being considered too small and her capabilities being doubted by police chief Bogo. However, a conspiracy involving the disappearance of different predatory civilians forces Hopps to team up with a sly fox named Nick Wilde. As they begin to uncover the mystery, they also begin to learn more about each other and overcome their differences to work together and save the day.The timing couldn't be more perfect for "Zootopia," since its themes about overcoming prejudice and stereotypes, realizing life isn't as perfect as one may think, and making great achievements in spite of one's differences or deficiencies, are displayed with a real degree of honesty and genuine emotion. These undertones are particularly evident in the backstories of the leads, Hopps and Nick. This might be the best Disney film to explore the issues that often plague modern society, and once the plot unravels, the audience starts to get the sense that things are not always what they may appear to be. In an effective visual metaphor, the animals are anthropomorphic when walking on two legs and wearing clothes, but revert back to being animalistic once they are forced to walk on all fours. The story is structured very neatly as well and never misses a beat, even at the revelation of certain twists. Some of the funniest scenes in the film include a naturist animal club led by a spiritual yak named Yax, a DMV operated by sloths that include the ironically-named Flash, and an homage to "The Godfather," as if it featured an Arctic shrew in the lead.The animation of "Zootopia" looks absolutely stunning, as does the visual design. There is so much emotion and energy prevalent in the characters, especially Hopps, Nick, and the DMV sloths, that it supports the movie in terms of its artistic and socially-conscious appeal. The different districts in Zootopia are named and designed to reflect the different species of animals that live there, including Little Rodentia for the rodent residents, Tundratown for lower temperature mammals, and Sahara Square for camels and other desert animals. The film also features a large cast, including Ginnifer Goodwin as Hopps, who brings a great deal of sincerity and optimism to the role, a perfect counterpart to Jason Bateman's cynical and anti-authoritarian turn as Nick Wilde. Tommy Chong, as Yax, brings back memories of the Cheech & Chong days, while Idris Elba gives off a stern demeanor playing police chief Bogo, J. K. Simmons shows off gruff enthusiasm as Mayor Lionheart, and superstar Shakira cameos as a singing gazelle sensation. Additional cast members include Octavia Spencer, Jenny Slate, Nate Torrence, Bonnie Hunt, and Alan Tudyk.With its relevant themes, well-developed characters, and invigorating moments of suspense, "Zootopia" could be considered a modern classic in the Disney canon.

title: My fave
content: I won't go I to much detail because I don't want to get spoilers here BUT imagine everything you like in a movie EVERYTHING from the lols of fun to the great plot twist to the amazing animation. Got it? Good now put all that amazingness into one single movie add to that cute anthro animals and BOOM you got yourself a Zootopia. This movie is the greatest Disney movie of all time. Also this movie was the one single movie that managed to get a genuine shock out of me with the plot twist, also it has a lot of great humour and the best I repeat the BEST animation E V E R! So shut up all yo haterz about "the twist villain being obvious" and "the bad sound track" the villain was really good and the song was a banger and I could not get it out of my head for a long time and I was ok with it. title: Clever analogy to modern world
content: 'Zootopia' uses all the advantages given to fable. The director's clever metaphor acknowledges sensitive race issues with so much wit and humor. Not just the race. People sometimes put self-limitation because of their sex, diploma, hometown, and other's preconception of who they are. Judy Hopps symbolizes everyone who fights against this stereotype constantly every day.The storyline of Judy and Nick solving the crimes of 'missing mammals' and 'predators turning into savages' + personal developments of two characters are complementary supporting each other. While two work together, they face their wounds caused by others' prejudice. Sometimes personal realization gives the leads to the crime.Diversity is the key word of this movie. Just count how many animals the director brings in to the film with each unique characters. From mouse to lion, all animals' personalities are so flavorful and humorous. Also, I find pleasure noticing each district with different colors, weathers, and characteristics. Animation team's efforts are well represented in this movie. It is such a high-quality animation to the level of being revolutionary.

title: Slippery Slope
content: Prey is evil, predators are innocent and entirely blameless. Sure. What could go wrong? Don't have to worry about schools teaching Critical Race Theory, Disney is doing it for them.

title: Kid's movie for adults
content:
So this is what a kids movie should be at least imo first of all it looks gorgeous the colours are vibrant the animation is fluid and the characters details are very fine in particular I noticed in a scene where a mice was talking and it legit looked like an old man due and the best part of this movie is the voice acting (in Hindi) just how perfectly the accents are given to each animal. No voice feels out of place and this just elevates the movie. You will laugh in this movie from start to end the characters are honestly hilarious this could have worked just fine with the comedy and animation but the story is also not neglected the main conflict feels real and tries to give a solid message which is rare to find in Disney
Also the world of this movie is something special I mean I was looking at the world more than the characters itself I would really like to visit the world again since zootopia 2 has been announced 😃FAVOURITE CHARACTER : cannot pinpoint one I guess the fox is in lead
FAVOURITE SCENE : That sloth scene omg all the buildup and flash really delivers it was 😂

title: Zootopia/Zootropolis
content: Zootopia, directed by Byron Howard & Rich Moore, and co-directed by Jared Bush was a charming childrens story, that targets a lot of sensitive subjects occurring today, like racism, drugs, etc. The story wasn't the most original, and quiet predictable, but the leads in Ginnifer Goodwin & Jason Bateman, kept it fresh and enjoyable.The screenplay was very witty, funny, and even dark. It was very well coordinated considering the large sum of writters and producers. Byron Howard, Rich Moore & Jared Bush put on a great showing of their creativity.Overall, this is a cute, and charming tale. Everything was written with a lot of heart, and well thought out, and it shows.

title: So beautiful and meaningful
content: It's the most beautiful and meaningful movie that I've seen , it's about been different and unique. I love this movie !!!!

title: One of the best animation from Disney
content: Zootopia is a 3D animation from Disney. The CG animation and the of this movie are very amazing. it is very flowing. This is the perfect animation for children and families. The color and tone of this movie are Eye-friendly color. This movie has a great story that shows the different animals that already evolved. They live in the same city as Zootopia. Like the different people that have different characters but live in the same city. The characters and the design of the characters in this movie are very nice and Attraction. This movie showing the friendship between Judy Hopps (rabbit) and Nick Wilde (Fox). Besides, this movie has many points that interesting to follow. Like it says in the movie "anyone can be anything", so Judy wants to be the police in Zootopia. Even though most of the police in Zootopia is a carnivore and she is herbivores. Finally, she made it. But the animals around her still laugh at her. In the end, Judy can make the masterpiece and become the top police. Moreover, Disney pays attention to the area where this movie was screening. Like the journalist in this movie change into the animals which relate to the land that they were screened. For example, in china is a panda. Also, the jokes in the movie are cute and new like the slot one. Which is the joke that I like the most. This is one of the best animations in 2016. title: One of the BEST animated films I've seen.
content: I think none can portray animals the way Disney do. Zootopia is full of amazing ideas & great detailing in animation. With brilliant story and screenplay it became one of my favourite animation movies. All characters are very well written, loved all of them. You'll get to see all kind of land animals in this film. MUST WATCH if you've not watched it yet.

title: This is ranking among Disney's finest!
content: Zootopia flew right into my top 5 of the Disney animated movies. And if nostalgia had nothing to say on that list, it would be on top!This is one of the few Disney movies which manages to master the fine balance between the most hilarious comedy and the darkest issues of reality. Nothing is thrown in just because it had to.It's a tale of a countryside bonnie who wants more out of life, she wants to persue that by going to the big city of Zootopia! She wants to be a cop, but everyone tells her that she hasn't got what's needed to become one simply because she is a rabbit. Beside that personal issue which has been seen a lot in recent Disney movies, there is a refreshing social comment on how society is full of prejudice, here exemplified by predator and prey. That is a brilliant metaphore!And there is no stone left unturned in the world of Zootopia! So much attention has been payed to details in every part of the city! Go watch it for yourself, otherwise I would spoil it!But such small things as how Judy Hopps shows her emotional state by how her ears are is one of the great details of the animation. She's a rabbit, get it?It will keep you at the edge of your seat, it will make laugh a lot, it will make you think about your own prejudice especially if you pay attention to our present times.Go watch it, you won't regret it!

title: Try to change
content: We may have evolved, but deep down we are still animals. Prejudice, discrimination, evaluation, using stereotypes to frame others in a small frame, just for their own easy. So try to prove that you are right, but don't want others to label you. Life is a little crazy, we often make mistakes. Whatever you are, change starts with you.
